result.execSummary:
The defendant Elyse E. Alix was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
10/31/2018:  Per Court of Appeals Decision dated and filed 10/23/2018 relating to cases 14CM1343, 15CF655, 15CF682, 15CF967, 15CF973, and 15CF974.
The judgment of conviction shall be modified to reflect the following consecutive sentences:
Case 14CM1343  Count 2, 9 months incarceration with 232 days of sentence credit.
Case 15CF973  Count 1, 4 years initial confinement and 4 years extended supervision.  Consecutive to Count 2 in case 14CM1343, with no sentence credit.
Case 15CF967  Count 1, 1 year initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  Consecutive to Count 1 in case 15CF973, with no sentence credit.
Case 14CM1343  Count 1, 2 years probation concurrent to 15CF682 Count 1 and 15CF967 with no sentence credit.
Case 15CF682  Count 1, 2 years probation concurrent to 14CM1343 Count 1 and 15CF967 with no sentence credit.
All the judgments on remaining counts and cases should be modified to reflect that defendants sentences on those counts are concurrent to this consecutive string with 232 days of sentence credit on each count.

miscConds.notes: plus 10% restitution surcharge.  To be determined.

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact with co-defendants.  No contact with victims.
Payment of supervision fees.  Participate and complete all programming/treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and DHS.  Submit DNA sample.
